oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Hon. Robert Briscoe, Lord Mayor of Dublin, at the Nashville airport, 1961 July 12
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Lord Mayor of Dublin, Ireland was met at the airport by the “Red Carpet Club” of Nashville and made Honorary Citizen and presented key to the city on July 12th, 1961. Robert “Bob” Briscoe was an Irish Fianna Fáil politician who served in the Oireachtas (Irish parliament) from 1927 to 1965. Briscoe was a Zionist and Irish revolutionary who became the first Jewish Lord Mayor of Dublin. The Lord Mayor of Dublin is the honorific title of the Chairman of Dublin City Council which is the local government body for the city of Dublin, the capital of Ireland. Forms part of Record Group 3, Metro Davidson County Photographer. 11 photograph negatives : b & w ; 4 x 5 in.
